ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Han's version of the course gives a detailed solid state background to the many characteristics and functionalities of electronic materials. If you are looking for a deeper understanding of electronic materials, this is the course to take.
Yes, I would recommend. I learned quite useful knowledge during this course.
I think that this course offers a useful introduction to crystalline semiconductors, so I would recommend it to students for whom that would be useful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course taught me a lot about band diagram and defects, which are quite helpful for me.
It supplemented my knowledge in EE, because I seemed to lack certain useful knowledge in EE after I got my bachelor's degree in physics.

This course gave me a good background on electronic materials (semiconductors in particular) which is particularly helpful for my research. Coming from a chemistry background, my foundation in semiconductors was fairly weak, so thiswas a very good overview course to get me acquainted with the field.
Most of the information I learned in this course is not directly applicable to my environmental engineering research, but a working knowledge of semiconductors will certainly be useful.
